summary: Completed comprehensive testing of AskMyCity application. All backend APIs and frontend functionality working perfectly. Tested all 3 cities (Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore), service display, navigation, error handling, and phone link functionality.
passed_tests: Get all cities API (/api/cities) - returns Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore
Get Delhi services API (/api/cities/delhi) - returns 4 services
Get Mumbai services API (/api/cities/mumbai) - returns 4 services
Get Bangalore services API (/api/cities/bangalore) - returns 4 services
Homepage loads with city dropdown and disabled View Services button
City dropdown shows all 3 cities (Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore)
View Services button enables after city selection
Navigation to Delhi city page works correctly
Navigation to Mumbai city page works correctly
Navigation to Bangalore city page works correctly
All city pages display correct city name and 4 service cards
All service cards show service type, description, and contact number
All phone numbers are clickable tel: links (Emergency: 112, Hospital: 102/108, Police: 100, Helpline: various)
Back button navigates from city page to homepage
Invalid city slug (/city/invalidcity) redirects to error page
Error page displays 'Oops! City Not Found' with proper message
Error page 'Back to Home' button navigates to homepage
success_percentage: Backend: 100% (6/6 tests passed), Frontend: 100% (19/19 features tested successfully)
